solution.text:
For an isothermal reversible expansion of an ideal gas, the work done on the system by the surroundings is given by
\(w = - n \times R \times T \times ln (\frac {V2}{V1}) \)
We can use the relationship below from the ideal gas equation during an isothermal process to calculate \(\frac {V_2}{V_1}\):\(\frac{P_1}{P_2} = \frac{V_2}{V_1}\)
\(\implies \frac{V_2}{V_1} = \frac {_{p1}_}{_{p2}_} = _{{trunc((Decimal(p1)/p2),3)}}_\)

Now substitute the value in the equation for work:
\(w = - n \times R \times T \times ln (\frac {V2}{V1}) \)
\(w = - _{k}_ \times 8.314 \times _{temp}_ \times ln (_{{trunc((Decimal(p1)/p2),3)}}_) \)
\(w = - _{k}_ \times 8.314 \times _{temp}_ \times ln (_{{trunc((Decimal(p1)/p2),3)}}_) \)
\(w = _{{trunc((k * Decimal('-0.001') * Decimal('8.314') * temp * ln(Decimal(p1)/p2)),3)}}_ \;kJ\)

content.text: _{k}_ moles of an ideal gas are compressed isothermally at _{temp}_ K from _{p1}_ atm to _{p2}_ atm. Calculate the work done on the system by the surroundings.(Calculate upto two decimal places)
